property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.queues
property.description: The list of child queues for the root queue. Here we are defining a single queue named 'default'.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.capacity
property.description: The percentage of resources allocated to the 'default' queue. 100 means it gets all the cluster resources.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.user-limit-factor
property.description: Allows a single user to occupy all the resources of the queue. This is useful for a single-user development environment.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.maximum-capacity
property.description: The maximum percentage of resources the 'default' queue can use.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.state
property.description: The state of the 'default' queue. Must be RUNNING to accept jobs.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.acl_submit_applications
property.description: Access control list for submitting applications to the 'default' queue. '*' means any user can submit jobs.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.acl_administer_queue
property.description: Access control list for administering the 'default' queue. '*' means any user can administer it.
